personal.name: Ayan Mulla
personal.tagline: MSc Computer Science Student | Data Scientist Intern @ CeADAR | MLH x Meta Production Engineering Fellow
personal.about: Graduate student at University College Dublin pursuing MSc in Computer Science, with strong experience in backend development, production engineering, and applied AI. Skilled in building scalable systems, orchestrating AI pipelines, and solving complex technical challenges through clean, reliable solutions. Passionate about cloud-native architectures, large language models, and real-time data pipelines.

description: Built an automated research pipeline using LangGraph to discover, filter, and analyze academic papers from arXiv.
Integrated LLMs for intelligent topic generation and full-text analysis.
Engineered modular workflows using Python, Pydantic, and PDF processing tools for scalable, state-driven orchestration.
Designed multi-stage AI relevance filters and structured output pipelines to generate CSV/JSON research insights.
Selected for a competitive fellowship to gain hands-on experience in production engineering with Meta engineers.
Participated in weekly training sessions, programming challenges, and deep dives on scalability, CI/CD, and observability.
Built and maintained infrastructure components using Linux, Python, Docker, and monitoring tools.
Collaborated in an agile team to develop reliable backend systems and debug production-level issues.
Configured web servers, DNS records, and SMTP to provide technical support for customers.
Automated email workflows to improve efficiency and reduce manual errors.
Resolved product-related technical issues and collaborated with developers to enhance customer experience.
Earned 500+ CSATs within 6 months by consistently delivering high-quality support.
Collected and cleaned live machine data via PLC and stored results in SQL databases.
Developed real-time dashboards with PHP and Chart.js for packaging machine KPI monitoring.
Deployed interfaces for global technician use and implemented proactive alerting systems.
Published a research paper based on the project work during the internship.

education.degree: Master of Science in Computer Science
description: Specializing in backend systems, data pipelines, and AI applications.

education.degree: Bachelor of Engineering in Information Technology
description: Built strong foundations in computer science, programming, and system design.

projects.name: NewsFlash
description: Built a real-time, fault-tolerant system for collecting and displaying news using distributed microservices.
Developed FastAPI-based APIs, used Kafka for stream ingestion, Redis for caching, and PostgreSQL for structured storage.
Deployed services with Kubernetes for scalability and resilience.

projects.name: Research Paper Publication
description: Published research paper based on PLC data collection and real-time monitoring dashboards built during IMA-PG internship.
